summary: This document is an email chain from August 10, 2019, between U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and other Justice Department officials discussing the death of Jeffrey Epstein by apparent suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It includes the official press release announcing Epstein's death and the initiation of an FBI investigation.

persons.context: He is the subject of the document, identified as the inmate found dead by apparent suicide in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center while awaiting trial for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York at approximately 6:30 a.m. from an apparent suicide. He was transported to a hospital and pronounced dead.

events.title: Epstein Arrives at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York under pretrial status after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on the morning of August 10, 2019, from an apparent suicide.
Epstein had been in pretrial custody at MCC since July 6, 2019, after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.
The FBI was immediately tasked with investigating the circumstances of Epstein's death.
The email chain shows U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and other DOJ officials coordinating their response and discussing the need for an Attorney General's statement.
